documentInfo.sourceFile: ATTCHMENT A_Inpatient Empiric antimicrobial Recommendations for common infections_ver 2025-04-02_shared with ED.docx

diagnostics.timing: Strongly encourage urgent LP, however antibiotics should NOT be withheld.

pathways.label: Community Acquired Meningitis

notes: Duration depends on the causative pathogen and clinical scenario.

procedureRecommendations: Consider adding dexamethasone 0.15mg/kg IV with the first dose administered 10-20 minutes before, or at least concomitant with, the first dose of antimicrobial therapy in adults with suspected or proven pneumococcal meningitis.
consults: ID consult highly recommended for the management of meningitis.

conditionalAdjuncts.condition: Patient is >50 years old, has a history of transplant, HIV, or is otherwise immunocompromised

notes: For vancomycin allergy, initiate ceftriaxone and CONSULT INFECTIOUS DISEASES.
Consider acyclovir IV based on clinical presentation and CSF results.

conditionalAdjuncts.condition: Patient is >50 years old, has a history of transplant, HIV, or is otherwise immunocompromised

notes: If listeria coverage is needed and TMP/SMX is contraindicated, use Meropenem + Vancomycin instead of Ceftriaxone + Vancomycin.
For vancomycin allergy, initiate ceftriaxone and CONSULT INFECTIOUS DISEASES.
Consider acyclovir IV based on clinical presentation and CSF results.
APPLIES TO PATIENTS WITHOUT A HISTORY OF SJS/DRESS.

notes: APPLIES TO PATIENTS WITH A HISTORY OF SJS/DRESS.
